entry.title: [Extensions] Test that confirms start worker behavior during running.
entry.content:
Before this test we didn't confirm that we do not attempt to start a

started/running worker with the

extensions_features::kExtensionsServiceWorkerOptimizedEventDispatch

feature.



After this change we can now confirm that it reduces the number of

redundant starts for a running worker (making this process more

efficient).



Bug: 1467015

entry.title: Remove crashing CHECK
entry.content:
A recent CL changed the container type for tracking output streams from

std::list to std::unordered_set. It also added a CHECK making sure that

we were remove exactly one stream from the container when streams are

being released.



This CHECK is crashing, so this CL removes it. It is suprising that the

check is hit, but removing it should be safe: if the streams aren't

present in the container, there's nothing to remove.



The CHECK is crashing too frequently for this bug to not be fixed

immediately. There will a follow up investigation as to why this is

happening at all.



Fixed: 1521299

Change-Id: Ibc4667de036d7c02e65300070da3e6728263c97f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234565

Auto-Submit: Thomas Guilbert

Commit-Queue: Dale Curtis

Commit-Queue: Thomas Guilbert

Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251687}

entry.title: Reland "Support debug mode in auctionReportBuyers reporting"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 60e5bace38daf60d2212fe5e5f9595448cbcee93



Original change was speculatively reverted due to tryjob failures, but

another cl was the actual culprit.



Original change's description:

> Support debug mode in auctionReportBuyers reporting

>

> Adds support for enabling the Private Aggregation debug mode for this

> type of reporting. This is enabled through a new, optional field on the

> auctionConfig (defaulting to debug mode disabled).

>

> See the proposed explainer update here:

> https://github.com/WICG/turtledove/pull/997

>

> This enables the new feature by default, but this feature will be

> disabled before reaching Stable if it not yet approved in an I2S.

>

> Low-Coverage-Reason: Simple mojom traits accessors

> Bug: 1513013

> Change-Id: I4f55b1f6d0563ab39e795a136a8b40e931e87313

entry.title: Update CanvasResourceProvider::Canvas() to return by reference
entry.content:
The paint canvas object is now guaranteed to always exists, so

returning by reference allows all caller to confidently use the canvas

without having to wonder whether the pointer is valid. Besides, callers

were never checking the pointer to start with.



Bug: 1484741

entry.title: Fixing null pointer crash
entry.content:
Frame wrapping functions such as media::VideoFrame::WrapExternalYuvData

can return null, but the return value is not check. This can lead to

a crash when processing corrupted video streams

entry.title: Add debug labels to Chromium memory dumps
entry.content:
Previous to this change, debug labels were only passed down to

OS graphics APIs. While this was great if you use OS tools for

debugging, it left out Chromium memory dumps.



This changes saves away the debug label as a const member of the

SharedImageBacking base class and passes it onto the memory dumper

in OnMemoryDump.



To keep information duplication to a minimum, the change removes the

client id from the debug label since it is already present in the

memory dump.



Bug: 1164111

entry.title: Removed downcasts to MemoryManagedPaintRecorder
entry.content:
The Canvas 2D contexts are all drawing to a MemoryManagedPaintCanvas.

CanvasResourceProvider::Canvas() however was upcasting this object to

the parent class, forcing callers to manually downcast by using a

static_cast before using it. static_cast is unsafe because it donsn't

do type validation. It's better to preserve the type safety across the

call stack.



Bug: 1484741

entry.title: [iOS blink] Aligning text decoration style and color for spelling
entry.content:
and grammar error with MacPort.



In 'paint/markers' web platform tests, we observed differences

in the style and color of text decorations for spelling and

grammar error between iOS and MacPort.

MacPort uses a red-dotted underline and a green-dotted underline

for these errors,

while iOSPort currently uses LayoutTheme colors (bright red/grey)

with a wavy style. [1][2]

Therefore, this CL updates iOSPort to adopt the same style and color

as used in MacPort.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/layout_theme.cc;drc=00194f3c72faa8dbd9e8e6fff05f82ce86019468;l=347

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/layout/layout_theme.cc;drc=00194f3c72faa8dbd9e8e6fff05f82ce86019468;l=351

entry.title: Make CSS UI updates reactive to application state, rather than
entry.content:
imperatively modifying CSS code from TS code.



Previously, any time the application wanted to pause read-aloud,

we needed to explicitly call `updateUiForPlaying()` and/or

`updateUiForPausing`. This updated the play/pause state the toolbar

component maintained, toggled CSS for the relevant buttons, and

imperatively called `maybeUpdateMoreOptions()`.



In this chain of CLs leading up to this, I've eliminated keeping

play/pause state in this component and instead bound it to its parent.

I also made changes to the UI to reactively change to state instead of

handling CSS logic in TS code. I also made `maybeUpdateMoreOptions()`

respond to toolbar resizing, so there's no more need for the

`updateUiForPlaying()` and `updateUiForPausing()` methods.



This also eliminates the circular dependency of toolbar and its parent

components calling each others functions.



Bug: 1474951

entry.title: Improve XML namespace error handling
entry.content:
A change in libxml which I will merge after this patch regressed some of

our tests. This patch implements fixes to make the libxml change work

without actually applying the libxml change. Merging this first behind a

flag without the libxml change will allow us to safely release the new

behavior. I will merge the libxml changes after the next branch point.



These changes were recommended by the libxml maintainer here:

https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/issues/653



The first fix is to null terminate the strings in

g_shared_xhtml_entity_result.



The second fix is to explicitly emit errors when attributes are parsed

which use a namespace that doesn't exist. We have a test for this and

before the libxml commit we had some odd behavior which would end up

saying that the xml was malformed which isn't actually the case.



Change-Id: I1602bf252f6ab9188ed8548abfe1386fc2141116

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5174719

Commit-Queue: Joey Arhar

Reviewed-by: David Baron

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1251632}

entry.title: [gc] Flip ownership of ShapeCache.
entry.content:
Previously the FontCache owned the ShapeCache, and the

FontFallbackList had a weak reference to the ShapeCache.



This is unnecessarily complex. Instead let the FontFallbackList own

the cache, and the FontCache have a weak reference to it. If we need

to perform a "purge" just clear the cache, instead of trying to

destroy the entire thing which will save most of the memory, and

keep the same invalidation constraint.



Bug: 1517025

Change-Id: I230e673d44956867f840a9bec0a0fa4807053612

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5231993

entry.title: Fetch serial number async for CBCM policy fetch
entry.content:
When send policy fetch request for CBCM, we need to call WMI API to get

serial number as part of device identification. However, this API

might be hanging and we should avoid using it on the main thread.



Create a async version of GetBrowserDeviceIdentifier function to get

serial number within a background thread.

entry.title: Convert reinterpret_cast<> of void* to static_cast<> in spans.
entry.content:
Reinterpreting a span is often an sign that a better conversion

method might be available. One exception is for making an initial

known type from a void* argument.



Remaining instances of /span(reinterpret_cast.*)/ would be good

targets for a forthcoming reinterpret_span() function.

entry.title: Process files in the uma events directory.
entry.content:
Add logic to process per-pid uma event files in

/var/lib/metrics/uma-events.d.



To reduce contention on reading and writing from the singular uma events

file /var/lib/metrics/uma-events, future work is planned for metrics

library to write per-pid uma event files instead of every process

writing to the same uma file.



We're adding the chrome-side changes first before adding this logic to

the platform side.



BUG=b:312758730

entry.title: [SPC] Fix using 'publickey-credentials-create' for SPC creation
entry.content:
In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5141746 we

made it possible to use publickey-credentials-create for SPC credential

creation in a cross-origin iframe. However the PaymentCredential mojom

interface was still only being instantiated based on the 'payment'

permission policy, so when the code tried to save the credential to the

database the call just silently failed.



This CL fixes the issue, by instantiating PaymentCredential when either

'payment' or 'publickey-credentials-create' is used.



A future CL will add unittests, when this code is moved per

https://crbug.com/1512605#c2



The change is still behind the

WebAuthnAllowCreateInCrossOriginFrame flag.



Bug: 1512605

Change-Id: I68b06c73f50361e2749522048eadadad165813b6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5231582

Reviewed-by: Ken Buchanan

entry.title: [GCM] Do not increase backoff delay on network changes
entry.content:
Backoff policy is ignored whenever network change happens, however if it

fails, the result may increase backoff delay. In some cases when there

are several network changes in a row (e.g. in case of VPN), it may

increase backoff delay to a maximum value within a couple of seconds.



This CL changes this behaviour (behind a feature toggle) not to affect

backoff policy on network changes.



Bug: b:314617075

Change-Id: Ibbf5005d04ffadf8f0d6cf5277c0e8c2b468fa1a

entry.title: Reapply "[gc] Make ShapeResult garbage-collected."
entry.content:
This reverts commit c5562ba1b3f5fa56a0d87e13d6b2235618d2a064.



Fixes the access to the cleared weak-pointer.



Original change's description:

> [gc] Make ShapeResult garbage-collected.

>

> This patch makes the ShapeResult & associated classes GC'd.

>

> The largest change in behaviour is the NGShapeCache (which currently

> isn't on by default). Previously this was using the HasOneRef API

> of the shape result to prune the cache. We aren't able to do that

> anymore, so instead just use a weak HashMap.

entry.title: Update autosharder sql to filter for chromium project
entry.content:
The branch builds use outdated shard counts since there's no cherry

picking. As a result, the branch builds usually have longer shards.

Although the query filters for most recently used shards (which is

usually from a main trunk build), there's a possibility that branch

build shard times are sneaking into the percentile calculations. So,

add a filter for the 'chromium' project.

If the USB device is disconnected while Chrome is waiting for the user

to interact with the Android USB device permission prompt then the

prompt will be automatically dismissed. The response handler function

needs to detect the case where the device is no longer in the device

map by ignoring the call as there is no longer anything that can be done

with the device.

entry.title: Update CanBeKeyboardFocusableScroller to not check Needs Layout
entry.content:
For accessibility code, we update Element::IsFocusable() to return false

for display-locked scroller elements, and no other focus trigger (e.g.

a positive tabindex). This avoids having to check if an element's layout

is up-to-date and avoids lifecycle violations.



Element::CanBeKeyboardFocusableScroller() is rewritten:

- if we're calling from accessibility and the element is display-locked,

return false

- if UpdateBehavior is StyleAndLayout, call UpdateStyleAndLayout()

- Return IsScrollableNode



Change-Id: Ia4a3967fb67621658c6beb4c115e6075db449e30

Bug: 1499038

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5201701

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Reviewed-by: Vladimir Levin

entry.title: [EditContext] Fix indexing in FirstRectForCharacterRange
entry.content:
The `location` parameter to EditContext::FirstRectForCharacterRange is

relative to the entire contents of the editable region, but

character_bounds_ (if HasValidCompositionBounds() is true) is indexed

only relative to the composition range within the editable region.

So, when indexing into character_bounds_ we must adjust `location` by

the start offset of the editable region.



The `length == 0` cases in FirstRectForCharacterRange were failing

to do this adjustment when indexing into character_bounds_.



Fix the array indexing and add a test.



Bug: 1507725

Change-Id: Ie742cfe0c56fb016d70b32b0f13c4d53e94db2d6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5219458

Reviewed-by: Anupam Snigdha

Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

entry.title: Add getHTML() and modify getInnerHTML() accordingly [2/2]
entry.content:
This CL adds a new getHTML() method, and modifies the existing

getInnerHTML() method accordingly. The behavior of getInnerHTML()

is not changed by this CL, but the implementation is modified to allow

the code to be shared. The new method follows the discussion and

conclusions here:

https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8867#issuecomment-1856696628



Essentially, that is:

1. Provide a boolean option to getHTML() that says "please serialize

opted-in shadow roots". The default for this option is false.

2. Provide an option to getHTML() containing a sequence of shadowRoots

that should be serialized, independent of whether they opted in via

the flag above.



This work falls under these two chromestatus entries:

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5081733588582400

https://chromestatus.com/feature/5102952270528512

and these two blink-dev threads:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/PE4VwMjLVTo

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/it0X7BOimKw



Bug: 1519972, 1517959

Change-Id: I5181a0702a12d550b4dab64c0c306ea2ccb25fa3

entry.title: Utilize the resize event to resize toolbar rather than imperatively
entry.content:
resizing for every event that can change the UI.



The `ResizeObserver` wasn't triggering when the toolbar changed width

because it was a `display: block`, which takes up the entire width

available to it. By changing it to `inline-block`, it only takes up

as much space as the contents inside it, and therefore triggers the

`ResizeObserver` when play/paused is toggled.



This makes it unnecessary for us to explicitly call

`maybeUpdateMoreOptions` imperatively on every UI change.



Bug: 1474951

entry.title: [Printing] Improve API's interaction with content settings
entry.content:
Currently there's no way for the blink code to tell whether an

actual error has happened during an API call or the corresponding

permission has been revoked / not granted by the user.



This CL restructures selected mojom functions and adds a new error code

called kUserPermissionDenied to represent permission-related issues.

entry.title: [dPWA] DownloadedIconsHttpResults measures results per icon URL and size
entry.content:
Since the WebAppIconDownloader now downloads icons per icon URL and

size, this makes the result be also measured per icon URL and size. To

do this, the following changes have been made:

1. DownloadedIconsHttpResults is keyed by the tuple of GURL and

gfx::Size with a custom comparator.

2. The callsites have been updated with a default size of (0,0) to

match current behavior.

3. The declaration has been moved to web_app_install_utils.h closer to

the other data structures which helps solve a clang error about

recursive includes of main.

4. Updates IconUrlWithSize to be a struct instead of a std::tuple.



Bug: b/319669415, crbug.com/1444121, crbug.com/1225906

entry.title: Pass the histogram shared memory region on child process launch.
entry.content:
This CL, behind a flag, updates the create/share flow for the histogram shared memory region between the browser process and its child processes. This allows the child processes to immediately allocate metrics from the shared memory region instead of waiting until the first browser/child IPC.



For the renderer, the shared memory region and allocator are created before the child is launched. This was already the case for the other child processes.



In the browser, the child process hosts expose the shared memory region to the ChildProcessLauncher/Helper so that the handle to the shared memory region passed to the child process on launch.



In the child, the metrics service initializes its histogram allocator to use the shared memory, on seeing the --histogram-shared-memory-region parameter.



See:



* go/improve-chrome-subprocess-metrics



Bug: 1028263, 1290457

Change-Id: I3dc7d59c42b6588dbf8ea31ca05254470d0a8b30

Low-Coverage-Reason: COVERAGE_UNDERREPORTED (crbug.com/1512202)
